dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA, FROM HIGH ABOVE, CRANES DOWN ON The Block.  T sidewalk is deserted, broken glass is everywhere, and it looks exactly as how one expects it to look, the morning after an uprising. The CAMERA NOW MOVES IN ON the WE LOVE storefront where Mister SeГ±or Love Daddy is in his familiar place behind mike. MISTER SEГ‘OR LOVE DADDY My people.  My people.  What can I say?  Say what I can.  I saw it but I didn't believe it.  I didn't believe it what I saw.  Are we gonna live together?  Together are we gonna live?  This is ya Mister SeГ±or Love Daddy here on WE LOVE RADIO, 108 FM on your dial, and that's the truth, Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE--MISTER SEГ‘OR LOVE DADDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISTER SEГ‘OR LOVE DADDY Today's weather. (he yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSER--MISTER SEГ‘OR LOVE DADDY He screams: MISTER SEГ‘OR LOVE DADDY

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Mookie jumps out of her bed; Tina sleeps by his side and their son Hector is between them. MISTER SEГ‘OR LOVE DADDY (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOOKIE Fuck!  My money! TINA Where are you going? MOOKIE To get my money. TINA Mookie, you must think I'm stupid or something.  You're gonna run outta here and I won't see your black ass for another week. MOOKIE Tina, it's not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mookie is putting on his clothes. TINA You don't care about me and you definately don't care 'bout your son. MOOKIE Tina, I'll be right back. TINA Be a man. MOOKIE I am a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINA Act like one then.  Be a man. MOOKIE Later. TINA You're to the curb.  You better step off.  Get a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mookie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SISTER'S BEDROOM--DAY
dialogues.text: Da Mayor wakes up in Mother Sister's big brass bed (she w born in it).  At first he has no idea where he's at, then sees Mother Sister sitting down across the room smiling a him. MOTHER SISTER Good morning. DA MAYOR Is it a good morning? MOTHER SISTER Yes indeed.  You almost got yourself killed last night. DA MAYOR I've done that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Mayor gets up out of her big brass bed. DA MAYOR Where did you sleep? MOTHER SISTER I didn't. DA MAYOR I hope the block is still standing. MOTHER SISTER We're still standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Mayor and Mother Sister both look out the parlor windo to see THE BLOCK and Mookie.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Mookie walks up to Sal's Famous Pizzeria as it still smoulders in the morning light.  Sal emerges from the wreckage; he looks like he might have slept there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAL Whatdafuck do you want? MOOKIE I wants my money.  I wants to get paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal looks at Mookie in disbelief. SAL Mookie, I always liked you.  Not the smartest kid, but you're honest. Don't make me dislike you. MOOKIE Sal, I want my money. SAL Don't even ask about your money. Your money wouldn't even pay for that window you smashed. MOOKIE Motherfuck a window, Radio Raheem is dead. SAL You're right, a kid is dead, but Mook, this isn't the time. MOOKIE Fuck dat.  The time is fuckin' now. Y'know I'm sorry 'bout Sal's Famous Pizzeria, but I gotta live, too. I gotta get paid. SAL We both do. MOOKIE We all know you're gonna get over with the insurance money anyway! Ya know da deal. SAL Do we now? MOOKIE Quit bullshitting. SAL You don't know shit about shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOOKIE I know I wants to get my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal has had it. SAL How much?  How much do I owe you? MOOKIE My salary.  Two-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal pulls out a wad and quickly peels off hundred dollar bills. SAL One, two, three, four, five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal throws the "C" notes at Mookie, they hit him in the chest and fall to the sidewalk. SAL Are you happy now?  That's five fucking hundred dollars.  You just got paid.  Mookie, you are a rich man, now ya life is set, you'll never have another worry, a care in the world.  Mookie, ya wealthy, a fuckin' Rockefeller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mookie is stunned by Sal's outburst.  He picks up the bil SAL Ya just got paid, so leave me the fuck alone. MOOKIE You only pay me two-fifty a week. (he throws two "C" notes back at him) I owe you fifty bucks. SAL Keep it. MOOKIE You keep it. SAL Christmas came early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both look at the two hundred-dollar bills on the sidewalk and refuse to pick them up.  It's a stalemate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOOKIE This is the hottest Christmas I've known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mookie counts his money. SAL It's supposed to be even hotter today. MOOKIE You gonna open up another Sal's Famous Pizzeria? SAL No.  What are you gonna do? MOOKIE Make dat money.  Get paid. SAL Yeah!...I'm goin' to the beach for the first day in fifteen years. Gonna take the day off and go to the beach. MOOKIE I can dig it.  It's gonna be HOT as a motherfucker. SAL Mookie? MOOKIE Gotta go. SAL C'mere, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mookie turns around and goes back. SAL Doctor, this is Sal talkin'. MOOKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAL Doctor, always try to do the right thing. MOOKIE That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAL That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mookie thinks about it, looks at the two "C" notes still smiling up at him.  He quickly scoops them up. MOOKIE I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mookie turns and walks away, Sal goes back into Sal's Famous Pizzeria to salvage what is salvageable, and The Block begins to awake from its slumber, ready to deal onc again with the heat of the hottest day of the year.
